meanings.definition: (verb) to filter gradually through a porous surface or substance
meanings.sent1: The coffee percolated through the filter slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rainwater percolated through the soil, nourishing the plants.
meanings.sent3: The gossip percolated through the office, causing excitement among the employees.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter percolated through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly percolated coffee filled the kitchen, enticing everyone to wake up.

meanings.definition: (adjective) filtered or strained through a porous substance
meanings.sent1: The percolated coffee had a rich flavor.
meanings.sent2: The percolated water was clear and pure.
meanings.sent3: She wore a percolated dress made of delicate lace.
meanings.sent4: The percolated sunlight filtered through the leaves, creating a dappled effect on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The percolated air in the forest was fresh and invigorating.

meanings.definition: (noun) the result of a liquid filtering through a porous substance
meanings.sent1: The percolated liquid collected at the bottom of the container.
meanings.sent2: He studied the percolated residue left behind after the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The chef used the percolated sauce to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The percolated mixture of flavors created a unique taste sensation.
meanings.sent5: The percolated essence of the herbs infused the broth with a delightful aroma.
